title: Purpose-Driven Microlearning to Strengthen Online Interpersonal Interaction Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: A language training program for novice professionals in healthcare, legal, or technical fields, conducted in smartphone-based constrained environments. It focuses on practical training for job scenarios requiring interactive communication and collaboration.

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% participation by utilizing goal-oriented interaction strategies (questioning/feedback/empathy) in online discussion forums.
Through role-playing activities via mobile messengers, learners perform expert-peer-supporter roles and execute three types of PII (pedagogical, social, and supportive interactions).
Learners earn an average of 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) in clarity/appropriateness/effectiveness categories through peer evaluation of interaction messages.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
